Knave’s Gambit.name: Knave’s Gambit
Knave’s Gambit.fullText:
Rogue Attack 23Knave’s Gambit

You use superior positioning to make a decisive attack that assures a nasty wound to your foe, or that its counterattack strikes one of its allies rather than you.

Encounter        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee or Ranged weapon

Requirement: You must be wielding a crossbow, a light blade, or a sling.

Target: One creature

Attack: Dexterity vs. AC

Hit: 4[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.

Miss: The target must take a free action to make a melee basic attack against an enemy of yours that is adjacent to it. You choose the enemy.

  Artful Dodger: The target gains a bonus to the attack roll and the damage roll. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier.


Update (10/4/2011)
Updated in Class Compendium.

Published in Player's Handbook, page(s) 125, Class Compendium.

Close Quarters.name: Close Quarters
Close Quarters.fullText:
Rogue Utility 10Close Quarters

You take cover beneath a much larger creature, making it harder for the creature to hit you.

Daily        Martial
Move Action      Melee 1

Prerequisite: You must have training in Acrobatics.

Effect: You move 1 square into the target’s space, provoking opportunity attacks as normal. While there, you have combat advantage against it, and it takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls against you. When the target moves, you move with it, staying in the same portion of its space. The target can take a standard action to make a Strength or a Dexterity vs. Reflex attack against you, without the -4 penalty. On a hit, the target slides you 1 square into an adjacent square, and this effect ends.


Update (10/3/2011)
Updated in Class Compendium.

Published in Player's Handbook, page(s) 122, Class Compendium.

Agile Footwork.fullText:
Rogue Utility 2Agile Footwork

Though your foe wants to move in closely, you’d rather keep your distance, so you nimbly move away.

Encounter        Martial
Immediate Reaction      Personal

Trigger: An enemy ends its turn adjacent to you.

Effect: You shift up to 3 squares.

Strike and Move.name: Strike and Move
Strike and Move.fullText:
Rogue Attack 3Strike and Move

You dart in, slash with your blade, and dart away before your enemy can answer.

Encounter        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee weapon

Requirement: You must be wielding a light blade.

Effect: You can shift a number of squares equal to your Charisma modifier. At any point during this shift, you can make the following attack.

  Artful Dodger: You instead shift 2 + your Charisma modifier squares.

Target: One creature

Attack: Dexterity vs. AC

Hit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.


Published in Dragon Magazine 381, page(s) 69.

Duelist's Demand.fullText:
Rogue Attack 5Duelist's Demand

You hem your foe in with a series of deadly strikes. It cannot move as long as your weapon is ready to strike.

Daily        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee weapon

Target: One creature

Miss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized and grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Swift Parry.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 381, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Swift Parry.fullText:
Rogue Utility 6Swift Parry

You deflect your enemy’s attack, causing the force behind its blow to send it off balance and leaving it vulnerable to your next attack.

Move Action      Personal

Effect: You move up to your speed, and you do not provoke opportunity attacks when leaving squares adjacent to your allies. Until the end of your turn, you have combat advantage against enemies that have at least one of your allies adjacent to them.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 178.
Tactical Trick.flavor: Your quick assessment of the battlefield shows you both where to step and which enemies are too distracted to defend themselves properly.
Tactical Trick.effect: You move up to your speed, and you do not provoke opportunity attacks when leaving squares adjacent to your allies. Until the end of your turn, you have combat advantage against enemies that have at least one of your allies adjacent to them.

Thug's Trick.name: Thug's Trick
Thug's Trick.fullText:
Rogue Utility Thug's Trick

With your enemy hemmed in, you keep your blade ready to punish it for any move it makes.

At-Will        Martial
Move Action      Personal

Effect: You can shift 1 square. Until the end of your next turn, enemies you flank provoke opportunity attacks from you if they shift.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 178.
Thug's Trick.flavor: With your enemy hemmed in, you keep your blade ready to punish it for any move it makes.
Thug's Trick.effect: You can shift 1 square. Until the end of your next turn, enemies you flank provoke opportunity attacks from you if they shift.

Tumbling Trick.name: Tumbling Trick
Tumbling Trick.fullText:
Rogue Utility Tumbling Trick

You dodge between your foes, slashing to the right and left with such speed that one attack leads into another.

At-Will        Martial
Move Action      Personal

Effect: You shift up to 3 squares. The next time you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack this turn, you also deal damage equal to your Strength modifier to a different enemy, which must be adjacent to you.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 178.
Tumbling Trick.flavor: You dodge between your foes, slashing to the right and left with such speed that one attack leads into another.
Tumbling Trick.effect: You shift up to 3 squares. The next time you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack this turn, you also deal damage equal to your Strength modifier to a different enemy, which must be adjacent to you.

Unbalancing Trick.name: Unbalancing Trick
Unbalancing Trick.fullText:
Rogue Utility Unbalancing Trick

You dodge low as you approach an enemy, protecting yourself from attack and setting up a strike to the knee or lower leg.

At-Will        Martial
Move Action      Personal

Effect: You shift up to 2 squares. The next time you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack this turn, you can knock it prone.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 179.
Unbalancing Trick.flavor: You dodge low as you approach an enemy, protecting yourself from attack and setting up a strike to the knee or lower leg.
Unbalancing Trick.effect: You shift up to 2 squares. The next time you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack this turn, you can knock it prone.

Sudden Leap.name: Sudden Leap
Sudden Leap.fullText:
Rogue Utility 2Sudden Leap

You jump from a standing position, surprising your foes.

Encounter        Martial
Minor Action      Personal

Prerequisite: You must have training in Athletics.

Effect: You jump a number of squares up to half your speed.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 180.
Sudden Leap.flavor: You jump from a standing position, surprising your foes.
Sudden Leap.prerequisite: You must have training in Athletics.
Sudden Leap.effect: You jump a number of squares up to half your speed.

Cunning Escape.name: Cunning Escape
Cunning Escape.fullText:
Rogue Utility Cunning Escape

As your enemy attacks, you leap aside to make your escape.

Encounter        Martial
Immediate Interrupt      Personal

Trigger: An enemy attacks you

Effect: You gain a +4 bonus to all defenses against the triggering enemy’s attack. At the end of the triggering enemy’s turn, you can also shift up to 3 squares as a free action.


Update (4/27/2011)
Action type changed to Immediate Interrupt.

Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 181.
Cunning Escape.flavor: As your enemy attacks, you leap aside to make your escape.
Cunning Escape.effect: You gain a +4 bonus to all defenses against the triggering enemy’s attack. At the end of the triggering enemy’s turn, you can also shift up to 3 squares as a free action.

Slip Aside.name: Slip Aside
Slip Aside.fullText:
Rogue Utility 6Slip Aside

You distract a foe to diminish the effect of an attack.

Encounter        Martial
Immediate Interrupt      Personal

Prerequisite: You must have training in Stealth.

Trigger: You are hit by an attack against your AC or Reflex.

Effect: You take only half damage from the triggering attack.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 183.
Slip Aside.flavor: You distract a foe to diminish the effect of an attack.
Slip Aside.prerequisite: You must have training in Stealth.
Slip Aside.trigger: You are hit by an attack against your AC or Reflex.
Slip Aside.effect: You take only half damage from the triggering attack.

Acrobat's Escape.name: Acrobat's Escape
Acrobat's Escape.fullText:
Rogue Utility 10Acrobat's Escape

As an enemy tries to move close, you slip away and leave the approaching foe off balance.

Encounter        Martial
Immediate Reaction      Melee 1

Prerequisite: You must have training in Acrobatics.

Trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.

Target: The triggering enemy

Effect: The target is immobilized until the start of its next turn. You then shift a number of squares up to your Dexterity modifier to a square that is not adjacent to the target.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 184.
Acrobat's Escape.flavor: As an enemy tries to move close, you slip away and leave the approaching foe off balance.
Acrobat's Escape.prerequisite: You must have training in Acrobatics.
Acrobat's Escape.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.
Acrobat's Escape.effect: The target is immobilized until the start of its next turn. You then shift a number of squares up to your Dexterity modifier to a square that is not adjacent to the target.

Counter-Step.name: Counter-Step
Counter-Step.fullText:
Rogue Utility 10Counter-Step

As your foe bears down on you, you use its momentum to maneuver it into position for your counterattack.

Encounter        Martial
Immediate Reaction      Melee 1

Prerequisite: You must have training in Athletics.

Trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.

Target: The triggering enemy

Effect: You can slide the target 1 square. You then shift up to 2 squares to a square adjacent to the target. You gain combat advantage and a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the target until the end of your next turn.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 184.
Counter-Step.flavor: As your foe bears down on you, you use its momentum to maneuver it into position for your counterattack.
Counter-Step.prerequisite: You must have training in Athletics.
Counter-Step.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.
Counter-Step.effect: You can slide the target 1 square. You then shift up to 2 squares to a square adjacent to the target. You gain combat advantage and a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the target until the end of your next turn.

Nimble Fingers.name: Nimble Fingers
Nimble Fingers.fullText:
Rogue Utility 10Nimble Fingers

You can snatch or stow an enemy’s possessions even in the heat of combat.

Encounter        Martial
Minor Action      Melee 1

Prerequisite: You must have training in Thievery.

Target: One creature

Effect: You draw one weapon that is sheathed or worn (but not held) by the target, stow a single item on the target, or retrieve a single item the target has stowed. If you are hidden from the target, the target is not aware that you have used this power.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 185.
Nimble Fingers.flavor: You can snatch or stow an enemy’s possessions even in the heat of combat.
Nimble Fingers.prerequisite: You must have training in Thievery.
Nimble Fingers.effect: You draw one weapon that is sheathed or worn (but not held) by the target, stow a single item on the target, or retrieve a single item the target has stowed. If you are hidden from the target, the target is not aware that you have used this power.

Slip from the Grasp.name: Slip from the Grasp
Slip from the Grasp.fullText:
Rogue Utility 16Slip from the Grasp

As a master thief, no chains can hold you, no enemy can corner you. You always have one last gambit.

Encounter        Martial
No Action      Personal

Trigger: Your turn starts.

Effect: If you are grabbed, the grab ends. If you are subject to an effect that is slowing or immobilizing you, the effect ends. You can also make a saving throw against an effect you are subject to that a save can end.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 188.
Slip from the Grasp.flavor: As a master thief, no chains can hold you, no enemy can corner you. You always have one last gambit.
Slip from the Grasp.effect: If you are grabbed, the grab ends. If you are subject to an effect that is slowing or immobilizing you, the effect ends. You can also make a saving throw against an effect you are subject to that a save can end.

Invisible Stalker.name: Invisible Stalker
Invisible Stalker.fullText:
Rogue Utility 22Invisible Stalker

You move with such grace that your foes cannot track you.

At-Will        Martial
Move Action      Personal

Effect: You become invisible and move up to your speed to a square that is not adjacent to any enemy. You become visible when the movement ends.


Published in Heroes of the Fallen Lands, page(s) 190.
Invisible Stalker.flavor: You move with such grace that your foes cannot track you.
Invisible Stalker.effect: You become invisible and move up to your speed to a square that is not adjacent to any enemy. You become visible when the movement ends.

Palming Strike.name: Palming Strike
Palming Strike.fullText:
Rogue Attack 1Palming Strike

You slash out with one hand while the other reaches into your pack to grab exactly what you need.

At-Will        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee or Ranged weapon

Prerequisite: You must be trained in Thievery

Target: One creature

Attack: Dexterity vs. AC

Hit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 21: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.

Effect: You may draw a single item from a bag or pouch as a free action.


Published in Dragon Magazine 389.
Palming Strike.flavor: You slash out with one hand while the other reaches into your pack to grab exactly what you need.

1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 21: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Palming Strike.effect: You may draw a single item from a bag or pouch as a free action.

Killing Shadow.name: Killing Shadow
Killing Shadow.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Killing Shadow.fullText:
Rogue Attack 13Killing Shadow

Springing out from hiding, you deliver a swift attack and move away before your enemy can figure out what just happened.

Encounter        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee or Ranged weapon

Requirement: You must be wielding a crossbow, a light blade, or a sling.

Target: One creature from which you are hidden

Attack: Dexterity vs. AC

Hit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.

Effect: The attack doesn’t cause you to stop being hidden, and you can move up to your speed as a free action.


Published in Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook, page(s) 54.
Killing Shadow.flavor: Springing out from hiding, you deliver a swift attack and move away before your enemy can figure out what just happened.
Killing Shadow.requirement: You must be wielding a crossbow, a light blade, or a sling.

Killing Shadow.effect: The attack doesn’t cause you to stop being hidden, and you can move up to your speed as a free action.

Tight Squeeze.name: Tight Squeeze
Tight Squeeze.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Tight Squeeze.fullText:
Rogue Attack 7Tight Squeeze

With a daring movement, you strike your foe and trick it into a narrow space.

Encounter        Martial, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee weapon

Target: One creature

Attack: Dexterity vs. Reflex

  Special: If you’re squeezing when you use this power, you don’t take the penalty to the attack roll from squeezing.

Hit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and you swap places with the target if possible, forcing it to squeeze if necessary. You then shift up to half your speed.


Published in Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook, page(s) 57.
Tight Squeeze.flavor: With a daring movement, you strike your foe and trick it into a narrow space.

Startling Offensive.name: Startling Offensive
Startling Offensive.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Startling Offensive.fullText:
Rogue Attack 3Startling Offensive

You strike before your foe even realizes that you are a threat.

Encounter        Martial, Weapon
Immediate Reaction      Melee 1

Requirement: You must be wielding a light blade.

Trigger: An enemy enters a square within 3 squares of you.

Effect: You shift up to 2 squares to a square adjacent to the triggering enemy and make the following attack with combat advantage.

  Target: The triggering enemy

  Attack: Dexterity vs. AC

  Hit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.


Published in Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook, page(s) 66.
